reviewText: THE FACTS OF LIFE was a sitcom that was a spinoff of DIFFERENT STROKES pertaining to the Drummond's former housekeeper Mrs. Edna Garrett(Charlotte Rae)who takes a job as the housemother of an all-girls only private school boarding care called Eastland School in Peekskill, New York with 4 girls under her care which were the spoiled rich girl Blair Warner(Lisa Whelchel), the tough, but streetwise Jo polniaczek(Nancy McKeon), the chubby impressionable Natalie Green(Mindy Cohn), and the youngest gossipy Dorothy "Tootie" Ramsay(Kim Fields).This 1984-85 Season is the last season where Mrs. G and the girls live at and work at Edna's Edibles as well as the last season this show was on Wednesday nights since it was moved to Saturdays in the Fall of 1985.This 1984-1985 Season also takes me back to memory lane to when NBC's motto was "Let's All Be There" which was NBC's slogan from the Fall of 1984 thru the Summer of 1986 and back to my childhood days to when I was 12 years old in the 6th grade.
Title: N/A

reviewText: its not like the show was noted for having some fabulous soundtrack like murphy brown.  I can't remember it getting that way so i can't see why they'd have a problem getting rights.  this shows been one of my top favorite shows and i still watch it every day and yet they only put out 5 out of 9 seasons. The last 4 seasons were great.  Huge disappointment.  Hopefully one day. Either that or that they'll just start coming on tv so i can record them but the cut off at 5, well, sucks.

reviewText: It seems I have been waiting forever for season 6! Please hurry!!!! I have been watching seasons 1-5 over and over.Waiting.......I am getting a little annoyed when I invest in a season (s) of DVDs with the intention of making a full set and they stop!!!! Frankly, it is BS! Why bother releasing the first season of a show and stop? Money yes????? I am sure Sony/Shout or whoever would know ahead of time that there would be difficulty with a certain season but they tease fans anyway.I am waiting to complete my series of The Facts of Life (and from the sounds of it, that will never happen). I bought the first season of Who's the Boss years ago and have never seen season 2. I just purchased the first season of Maude and now am reading that season 2 may never be released.I am thinking this is just wrong! I am always willing to purchase DVDs legally but honestly, they leave you no choice sometimes. If I could get seasons 6-9 of the Facts of Life I am going to buy it. Sick of this!
Title: N/A

reviewText: The scripts and the directing (mostly Asaad Kelada) are just top notch.  What is with these people that they don't release the final 4 seasons?  They're trying to figure out exactly how many more pennies they can get by stretching out the releases? What a bunch of weenies!  Release the rest of them and be done with it and stop trying to figure everything out to the penny.  You're just going to wind up losing in the long run by being too cute.
Title: N/A
